meanings.sent1: The hurly in the market was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The hurly of the crowd made it hard to hear.
meanings.sent3: The hurly of the children playing was music to my ears.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the hurly of the storm, she found peace.
meanings.sent5: The hurly of the city streets never seemed to quiet down.

meanings.sent1: The hurly of the construction site was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The hurly of the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: The hurly of the barking dogs startled the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The hurly of the traffic outside was like a constant drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The hurly of the alarm clock jolted him awake every morning.

meanings.sent1: The hurly of the office during the move was chaotic.
meanings.sent2: The hurly of the classroom after recess took a while to settle.
meanings.sent3: The hurly of the kitchen during dinner preparation was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: In the hurly of emotions, she found it hard to think clearly.
meanings.sent5: The hurly of the traffic jam seemed never-ending.
